alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 06 at 7:06PM MDT until April 07 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MDT /NOON CDT/ TO 7 PM MDT /8 PM CDT/ THURSDAY... ...BLOWING DUST WARNING HAS EXPIRED... ...HIGH WIND WARNING HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Northwest winds gusting up to 70 mph and blowing dust with visibility less than one quarter mile. * WHERE...For the High Wind Warning on Thursday, the entire Tri- State area. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning on Thursday, from 11 AM MDT /noon CDT/ to 7 PM MDT /8 PM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Severely limited visibilities are expected. Travel will be dangerous and life-threatening. Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Several reports of near zero visibility have been received across the warned area. We urge travelers to get off area roadways as soon as possible due to the zero visibility dust storm developing.
info.instruction: People with respiratory problems should make preparations to stay indoors until the storm passes. Be ready for a sudden drop in visibility to near zero. If you encounter blowing dust or blowing sand on the roadway or see it approaching, pull off the road as far as possible and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights all the way off and keep your foot off the brake pedal. Remember, Pull Aside, Stay Alive. A High Wind Warning means strong winds are either occurring or imminent which could lead to property damage...reduced visibility in blowing dust...and loss of vehicle control. A High Wind Warning is issued for sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
